This  #CivicLearningWeek the Bill of Rights Institute is encouraging students to turn civic knowledge into action. What does it mean to exhibit the Founding Principles? The story of America involves figures from diverse backgrounds and differing viewpoints. Using in-depth narratives and primary sources, American Portraits allows students to delve into the lives and backgrounds of some of our most notable figures and analyze their decisions in reaching for liberty, equality, and justice. Bring these stories into your classroom today,  https://lnkd.in/e5trXUfa. Interested in supporting curricula like American Portraits? Visit,  https://lnkd.in/ePsJtSJy.

A thriving democracy depends on citizens who understand their rights and responsibilities. The Bill of Rights Institute is dedicated to equipping students and educators with resources that foster constitutional knowledge, critical thinking, and civic engagement. The Institute provides free educational materials, student programs, and professional development for teachers, helping to cultivate the next generation of informed and active citizens. Their work is especially timely as we approach  #CivicLearningWeek, a national initiative that emphasizes the importance of civic education in strengthening democracy. Learn more about how partner organizations like the Bill of Rights Institute are advancing civic learning and engagement:  https://lnkd.in/eTsm2PJu

What does it mean to defend America's freedoms? In this episode of Honoring Service, CW5 Phyllis Wilson, MPA, BSN, RN Wilson joins BRI's Gerald Gangaram to reflect on her 37-year career in the Army, the connection between service and civic duty, and the responsibility of young people to lead by example. Wilson shares powerful stories of women in American history who fought for our nations principles, including those who served under General John J. Pershing in WWI, before women even had the right to vote. As president of the Military Women's Memorial, Wilson continues to honor the legacy of over 3 million women who have defended our nation. Watch to learn more about her story,  https://lnkd.in/eeK4qJEp.  #BillofRightsInstitute  #BRI  #HonoringService

This  #WomensHistoryMonth, celebrate the women who helped shape our nation's history and championed the principles of liberty, justice, and equality. This month and always, we honor their legacy by providing resources that bring their stories to life in classrooms across the nation. Explore our Votes for Women curriculum which brings the story of the 19th Amendment to life today!  https://lnkd.in/eBHHuTVH.  #billofrightsinstitute  #BRI  #WomensHistoryMonth

Find the Bill of Rights Institute Team at the SXSW EDU Conference March 3-5th. The South by Southwest EDU Conference and Festival empowers the community to advance teaching and learning as an international education conference. Attending the conference? You'll have the opportunity to meet Rachel Humphries D. Humphries, Senior Director of Civic Learning Initiatives, Derrick Anthony Reed, Director of Strategic Partnerships, and Emma Grahn, Senior Project Lead for Civic Learning Initiatives.

February is Black History Montha time to reflect on the profound contributions, achievements, and struggles of Black Americans throughout US history. At the Bill of Rights Institute, we honor the voices and stories that have shaped our nation's journey toward equality and justice. We provide educators and students with tools to explore the legacy of civil rights, activism, and leadership in America through resources like primary source documents, videos, and lesson plans. Discover our timeline to bring Black History Month into your classroom  https://lnkd.in/eMypMS7K
